job_title: ICU Registered Nurse in Victorville, CA
pros: You learn a lot and have a lot of autonomy.
cons: Toxic management. Understaffed almost all the time. Less pay than other hospitals in the area. Not many opportunities for advancement.

review_title: You work hard for your paycheck!
pros: I love how team work is strongly emphasized in this facility. On the Med-surg floor, a nurse never gets left behind by their fellow coworkers. The managers, house supervisors, and director will assist on the floor when needed. The majority of staff here are friendly and helpful. You can climb up the ladder quickly. One day you’re a floor nurse and then next you’re the Charge nurse or Manager or even the Director. There’s a lot of opportunities for growth. You can switch to a different unit easily. They will hire new grads. You can request for an extended orientation. You get a lot of experience working with difficult patients and stressful situations. I would say the awesome people here is what made leaving this place difficult.
cons: New grads training new grads. Some services are not available on the weekend leading to delay in patient care. Some doctors are hard to get ahold of. You work hard for your money. Not enough working COWs. You can get verbal orders from Doctors.

review_title: a place to start, but not finish
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Victorville, CA
pros: The ER at night has great team work, great relationships with the doctors, and allows you to learn and grow at a fast rate.
cons: Nearly none of the equipment works, the management doesn't care about staff, and when there are safety concerns they are not heard by management

pros: Easy but physical job. Good hours.
cons: The hospital is pretty small.

pros: Like my unit and co workers
cons: Hours are not steady and management tries to cut costs as much as possible

review_title: Amazing learning experience working in the ER and had such an amazing ER team,
pros: This position as a nurse in the ER had been my very first job as a nurse and had learned so much even though at times it had challenging being a fast paced position. I actually feel that the ER dept is where I belong. I enjoy the fast pace of the ER and having that one on one care with the patients. Getting into this field of being a nurse I wanted to make a difference in someones life but in all reality the patients have made a difference in my life. I take my position as a nurse very seriously and will go above and beyond the care and needs of my patient. I also liked that my hours were 3 days 12 hours shifts and at times 5 days with 12 hour shift with 5 days off in a row. I have continued to enjoy working in a hospital setting.
cons: Working on days when the ER is short staffed with the nurses. Although it had been rough at times I wouldn't trade working in the ER for anything. I would have continued to work at this location but the commute was very difficult at times with 3 hours in traffic and 2 hours to get home.

pros: The people here (coworkers) are amazing. There was great teamwork and just a family vibe among the team.
cons: They are often short-staffed. They go without supplies regularly, like flushes for example. They have run out of flushes to where you're drawing up normal saline out of a 1L bag into an empty 10ml syringe. They have low pay and a high turn over rate so the majority of nurses are new. When I was being trained in ICU I had 5 years of experience. The girl training me had been a nurse for 11 months. She said, " I'll go to you for clinical decisions and you can ask me about the computer system and stuff". Oh and the computer system is HANDS DOWN the WORS I have even seen. It was worth quitting just to leave that computer system behind.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Apple Valley, CA
pros: None. None. None. None. None! (I had to enter 5 words!!)
cons: Don’t respect their employees or stand behind them in any way. No union, so you have no one standing on your side. And consequently, pay and benefits are terrible. If your lucky, you’ll get $0.75 raise a year, if they remember to give you a yearly review. Very quick turn around of staff and these are usually new grads. They hire new grads because they are desperate, train them and after they get their year experience they move on to a real hospital that will respect them and pay them better. Oh and by the way, they also hire new grads for their NICU and ICU. That’s scary!! They are always on the verge of bankruptcy as well.

job_title: Emergency Room Technician in Victorville, CA
pros: ER is a close group of people and come together when needed, flexible work schedule most of the time, lots of opportunities to pick up overtime if wanted.
cons: No good management, emergency room runs in chaos, no seniority staff with experience to learn from all new grads and incompetent LVNs.

pros: Being able to work with nurses and helping patients.
cons: We always get different schedules every other day which cause confusion among all employees. We're understaff and we rarely have supplies.

pros: working with variouis technologies  such as cisco LAN/WAN switching and routing, citrix XenApp/desktop 7.6, solarwinds NPM, NCM, IPManagement, EMC VNX , avamar , data domain and VMware 5.5.
cons: corporate take over and changed and slowly those technologies and job responsibilities have changed.

review_title: Protect Your License - RUN!  Do Not Work Here!
pros: There are no PROS!  This is an awful place.  If you're a new RN or a new grad - do yourself a favor and apply elsewhere!
cons: Dishonesty, Unprofessionalism, Incompetent CNO / Management, Financially Unstable, Horrible Environment, No Leadership, Lowest Wages in the High Desert
